output.title: The Rise and Fall of Blockbuster: How Netflix Changed Entertainment Forever
output.caption: A tale of two titans in the world of entertainment.
output.resume: Join us as we explore the rise and fall of Blockbuster, the once mighty video rental chain, and how its demise paved the way for streaming giant Netflix to revolutionize the way we consume entertainment forever.

scenes.script: In the late 1980s and early '90s, there was one name that ruled the world of home entertainment: Blockbuster.
scenes.image_prompt: A busy Blockbuster store, filled with VHS tapes.

scenes.script: I remember as a kid, my parents would take me to Blockbuster every weekend. It was like going to Disneyland for movies.
scenes.image_prompt: A young David with his family at a Blockbuster store.

scenes.script: But as the internet became more accessible in the late '90s, everything started to change. Netflix saw an opportunity and launched their DVD-by-mail service in 1998.
scenes.image_prompt: A scene from a '90s office with early Netflix employees.

scenes.script: Blockbuster, however, was slow to react. They dismissed the idea of mail-order movies and even turned down an offer to buy Netflix for just $50 million in 2000.
scenes.image_prompt: A Blockbuster manager laughing off the idea of renting movies by mail.

scenes.script: I remember when we finally got Netflix, it was a game-changer. No more late fees, no more driving to the store. We could just watch what we wanted, whenever we wanted.
scenes.image_prompt: David and his family enjoying a movie at home with their first Netflix DVD.
